title: Seattle's Been Sleepless, Now It Goes Strawless - Earth911
body: Sep 5, 2017 strawless-seattle. September is the month Seattle stops sucking. At least, that's what nonprofit organization Lonely Whale Foundation hopes as it launches " Strawless in Seattle " throughout the Pacific Northwest city. The campaign urges residents and businesses to trade in their plastic straws for more-sustainable ...
readable_content:
user (2023-12-08): This article talks about the "Strawless in Seattle" campaign launched by the nonprofit organization Lonely Whale Foundation. The campaign aims to eliminate the use of plastic straws in Seattle by encouraging residents and businesses to switch to more sustainable alternatives or no straws at all. Various partners, including sports teams, restaurants, and the Sea-Tac Airport, have pledged to support the initiative. The campaign is part of the Strawless Ocean global initiative, which aims to remove 500 million plastic straws from the U.S. waste stream. The article also suggests alternative options to plastic straws, such as paper, glass, metal, or bamboo straws, and encourages people to join Seattle in skipping straws during the month.

- Some people might find the suggestion of joining in the campaign interesting.

- Yes, it's a great initiative to reduce the use of single-use plastics and promote more sustainable alternatives.
summary:
The conversation expresses support for the "Strawless in Seattle" campaign, praising its initiative to reduce single-use plastics and promote sustainable alternatives. The overall sentiment is positive and supportive of the campaign's goals. 

Sentiment: 0.8
